explains: n. 预期，预料；期盼，期望；先现音
wordGroup: in anticipation of 期待，预期

sentences.en: There's been an atmosphere of anticipation around here for a few days now.
sentences.cn: 一种期待的氛围在这儿已存在几天了。

sentences.en: He bought extra food in anticipation of more people coming than he'd invited.
sentences.cn: 他预料来的客人会比邀请的多，就多买了食物。

sentences.en: Troops in the Philippines have been put on full alert in anticipation of trouble during a planned general strike.
sentences.cn: 预期在计划的总罢工期间会有麻烦，在菲律宾的军队已处于完全戒备状态。
